Entry.252: Was ordered to get my gear together to join a party going down the Canal to Serapia, and expect to have a little work to do there, on leave this afternoon. I purchased a few things for Elsie.
Entry.253: Mail arrived today. Although only very small provided me with a letter from Mother & Elsie. Ready to leave for Serapium .
Entry.254: Left Ishmalia at 9 am and steamed down the Canal to Serapium where we take over the pontoon bridges across the Canal. Pitched tents and formed Camp at 12.30 pm. Had a look around, nothing much to see though we went a long distance to see it.
Entry.255: Hear we are to take over the bridge from 1stCompany of Engineers tomorrow. Hope it is correct. Very hot down here and plenty of sand.
Entry.256: Medic and Regatta yesterday passed us homeward bound. Have scored a sweet number here now.
Entry.257: "Oriana", "Osterley", passed through, the latter with mails at 10 pm. Fine weather.
Entry.258: 10 men left yesterday on 48 hrs leave. "Neela", "Athos" & "Moldavia" passed laden with troops. Received Elsie's 25th letter.
Entry.259: "Ceramic" passed outwards to India, tommiesaboard, plenty of work today.
Entry.260: Bracey paid us a visit and I have stated the grievance of censorship to him, he has promised to enquire.
Entry.261: "Ceramic" & two Hunters of the latest river type with 2, 6", 3 . The "Cornwallis" also passed about.
Entry.262: Met Roy Watson this morning, usual work on bridge, plenty of traffic to & fro.
Entry.263: Serapeum. Weather very warm, & flies become an abomination.
Entry.268: Rained all day and had a good swim, very busy on bridge. 3 Camel Corps going out.
Entry.271: Got a letter from Les & one from Roy.
Entry.272: Busy with traffic, one horse over the side through accident.
Entry.273: Left for Cairo at 8 am this morning, arrived at Cairo at 4 pm, saw some sights.
Entry.274: Met Les & went to Pyramids, had photos taken. Saw other sights.
Entry.275: Left Cairo 6 am, arrived Serapeum 4 pm.
Entry.276: "Before the break", 3 days pay for 9 hours adrift.
Entry.277: Serapium, same old monotony, save that of Grannie falling into the ditch.
Entry.278: Serapeum. Very Very Hot & the the pestilence of flies still continues.
Entry.279: Sandstorm when it was sore. Wrote to Elsie & enclosed photos, the postcards.
Entry.280: Received newsof Roys marriage, by one of his mates. Could not believe it of him. Met Freddie Brown, Ted Payne & one of the lads.
Entry.282: Saw a girl today on one of the passing boats. Eyes pretty bad, & we were paid.
Entry.283: Felas, Ma fish. Some musquoise gent borrowed my belt when I was swimming.
Entry.284: Wrote Mum, and received Wedding Card from Roy. Received shock from the letter.
Entry.286: Sandstorm today. Wrote Elsie, plenty of traffic, met Cecil Staple, also young Sutcliffe.
Entry.287: On night work instead of Quinn, nice cool job.
Entry.288: Les Boyay arrived, Jack & Bob Browning have both been given a L.S. Doug is now a P.O., I suppose I am still in disfavor.
Entry.289: St Patrick's day and no green anywhere, Rained all day.
Entry.290: The Prince of Wales arrived here this morning and inspected our Unit, also the Bridge. He is quite a youngish fellow and has a very smooth countenance very handsome featured.
Entry.293: Notice to quit our present camp came along this morning, and midnight found us all aboard a cattle truck bound for we believe Suez, to join up the IX Army Corps. Good, we should soon be on the move for ?.
Entry.294: Arrived, after a "rattling" ride, at Kubri West, i.e. the sight of our new camp. Feeling pretty well fagged tonight.
Entry.295: Getting things level after the storm. Very warm in the new camp.
Entry.296: Phew! gee is it not hot, What! Received a short letter from Roy, and received recom from Alex Cameron.
Entry.297: Had a "make & mend" f.c. holiday, and gee are we not glad to plunge headlong into the canal, splendid sport today.
Entry.298: New sphere of work, rather tedious job, but like everything else, got to be done. Very Hot & Sultry.
Entry.299: Finished tedious job, and spent the remainder of the day swimming with Andy.
Entry.300: Pay day, but mines mortgaged up to the last ninepence, broke once again, alas.
Entry.301: Anniversary and celebrations, Taube paid a visit.
Entry.309: Taube paid visit to Cairo, and dropped two bombs on its way.
Entry.312: Taubes - blew up F.F.'s Office, no casualties.
Entry.313: Taube - no damage. Had a very grand concert - great success.
Entry.314: Expeditionary party left for ? and I have the rotten luck to be left behind. I am sorry that I am not with you Bunty, but, I don't suppose we can always choose.
Entry.315: Party left in tow of "Sir Colin Bell". Good luck to the Boys.
Entry.316: Billy rejoined from hospital. He looks well.
Entry.317: Distribution of Xmas Gifts, and gee what a difference to last year. We are certainly comfortable, but of course we complain.
Entry.318: Things very quiet. Pay day. The usual crowd of drunks.
Entry.320:
Eve, by jove wouldn't I like to be home in Sunny New Sth, or even Vic. Oh' well not much use growling.

25th Dec
Had a bonza time, spent it aboard the barge with Les, Mc, Alex 2, and Jack Murray. Now have all their autographs. Had the first rain since last February. Rather a coincidence.
Entry.321: Very cool today with fairly heavy rain. Saw the sports, which were pretty amusing. Rained like Billy oh in the evening. We were flooded.
Entry.322: Rainy day, nothing new. No news of party on Secret Mission. Received 3 letters from Vic. Australian mail arrived per "Malwa". Camel Corps came in from Stunt, Lost 2 Camels.
Entry.323: 1stnews from Expedition arrived this morning, all correct. "Morea" bound for Australia, arrived Suez 1410, left 2010. English mail in.
Entry.324: Quiet day, plenty of work, Jarvis very well.
Entry.325: Young Jarvis died at 0930 this morning. Hard luck for the poor little kiddies. I have been told off for firing party. Letters for Mum, M, C.
Entry.326: New Year Eve, gee whiz, have been to Suez all the afternoon, attending young Jarvis funeral. Very impressive sight, and a good attendance by our boys.
Entry.327: I am afraid I have a bad entry for this Day. Poor old Armstrong's body was found in the Canal near Ghurka's Post, caught in the wire entanglements, to be buried tomorrow.
Entry.328: Armstrong's Funeral, largely attended 70 in all. Very wet and windy, wind is now blowing from S.W. very cold.
Entry.329: Bitterly cold, rain squalls and very high winds from W. Received preliminary orders to move. Inquiry re Armstrong tomorrow.
Entry.330: Rained all day and wind from Sth West, very boisterous and cold. Orders from C/O re removal.
Entry.331: Enquiry into death of Bob Armstrong, nothing very fresh. Rained like blazes throughout the day.
Entry.332: Fresh wind and sunshine, once again and how pleasant these two are. Received my autograph book from Tickner Edwards.
Entry.333: Received word at 2330 that the Skipper was returning. Nothing fresh regarding move.
Entry.334: Capt arrived from El Arish at 2400. Type to Alex, with kits. Small portion English mail arrived. Orders to move probably arrive tomorrow. In all probability the 12th Jan.
Entry.335: Hell of a job today. Frank in bed and I have to do his yakker while he is thus engaged. Skipper wired for Fraser, so suppose he will be back tomorrow night.
Entry.336: Doug coming home tonight. Alas did not arrive. Skipper going to Ismailia tomorrow. All the Shallufa lads marched in and all the outstations reported to Hdqs. I see a great number of old faces but also a great number of new faces too.
Entry.337: Doug came back pm 1315 train. He looks well. Glad to see him back. Skipper went to Ismailia, left by 0700 train. Expect to leave on Sunday or thereabouts.
Entry.340: Evacuated to hospital with Cellulitis of knee.
Entry.341: Opened my knee under chloroform, and it is now very painful.
Entry.342: As this hospital is moving, I have been transferred to Govt Hospital which is some show.
Entry.343: Knee has broken out again, as has again been opened under Ethyl Chloride.
Entry.344: Knee once again opened under Ethly Chloride and shows no signs of recovery.
Entry.345: My knee was once again opened and the whole of the infected portion of the Busra scrapped. This under H.Chz.
Entry.346: "Baby" left, also Sgte's, Sgt Major Upton Upton London, and Alf Oldfield, Laney left for Rabigh today.
Entry.347: Transferred today from Suez to Cairo, knee feeling good. 300 wounded Aust from Gaza on same train, feel rather an imposter. Arrived
Entry.348: A.I.H. had a decent meal for a change.
Entry.349: Very heavy casualties at Giza by all appearances. Men being operated on all through night & day.
Entry.350: Left hosptl went to Convalescence at Abassia, rather a nice place.
Entry.351: Still in convalescent Depot, not too bad for a change.
Entry.352: Returned to Unit today thank goodness.
Entry.353:
The surprise I have received today is a rude one, Billy has transferred, as also have a great number of other fellows of the old train. I do not think I will be able to stomach too much of the latest fellows.

Have had opportunity of transferring or going back to Aust offered to me and willseeEddie before I decide.
Entry.354: Saw Eddy at Moascar today, he was doing a guard at Q.M. Stores. Have decided to transfer into Art. with him.
Entry.355: Requested to be allowed to transfer to Art. and was granted by Buller. Had a long chat with Andy & Doug, the latter lad I am loathe to leave. The Unit leaves for Aust on Sunday next so Doug tells me. Had a drink with Doug and enjoyed my chat.
Entry.356: Have taken oath of enlistment under the A.I.F. once again, and left Kubri on the 10.15 am for Moascar.
Entry.357: N.B.T. left Suez for Aust per H.T.S. "Bulla", I am glad young Doug is off. Suffering from sore throat, going in to isolation for same.
Entry.359: Throat better and feeling good, - no duty.
Entry.360: Taken to hospital suffering with ? diptheria - feeling rotten - cannot speak, temperature 103°.5.
Entry.361: In hospital, a little better, temp as above, still without voice.
Entry.362: Suffering from acute Larnyitis so the report reads, getting better, temp 102°.
Entry.364: Discharged today. Arrived at Camp and found all the boys save Smith (16) have gone overseas, and that they sailed the day after I went to hospt. Am awfully blue about the matter. Met Bill McKay from hospital. He looks seedy.
Entry.365: Sandstorm - rich enough to extract many curses from those unfortunate to be in same.
Entry.366: Went swimming in afternoon, at Lake Timsah. Received a letter from old Ritchie, also some photos of Jock. Speaking to Flood, (R.S.M.) who tells me we shall not remain here a very long time. Went to pictures with Smithy.
Entry.367:
Warned off to be ready for immediate despatch, appended by S.M. Flood. Working in Orderly Room.

11th June
Had fairly busy day with records, and am also feeling good and tired. 0400 Routine commenced today.

12th June
Pay Day. Went in to Ismailia, and had a quiet evening, sent a Mosaic box from Chellarams, to Toots, also purchased a pr pyjamas - and a money belt.

The sketch on the preceding page, is so drawn, to give my friends a fair idea of my late Units work whilst in Egypt.

The distribution of troops on the Canal during 1916/17 was so arranged, as to cut the Canal up in three sections, which were, as follows. From P. Said to Ismailia No 3 Sect - Ismailia to Kabrit Nth No 2 Sect - Kabrit Nth to Suez No 1 Sect.

At main "posts" on the Canal 3 bridges were swung, and were generally used at the rate of traffic on two per day.

At main "posts" also, a water filter station and pumping house was erected. Whilst at Serapeum, however there was no necessity to use any of our Units Engrs. At Kubri, Shalluffa, and the Rl. heads of both posts our Units Engs contolled the water supply. From 22nd Feb, 1916 to
Entry.368: we operated at No 2-3 Sections. From May 4th to 28th February 1917, we operated in No 1 Sect. From
Entry.369: to 29th Feb, a detachment operated at El Arish, and Gaza, also Bellah.
Entry.370: Had a fairly long day, received letter from Doug, posted at Aden - contains rather good advice. 4000 Tommies arrived from Salonika.
Entry.371: Still busy with Rolls, etc. Test for swimming held this afternoon. Fatty Sherwood represents Aust.
Entry.372: Orders arrived for Smithy to proceed to England - and somehow or other mine have been held up. Mr Chavaul has wired Cairo for Authority for me to proceed but so far no answer has been received. More Tommies from Salonika. Received sailing orders for 1000 tomorrow.
Entry.373: After many farewells we left by the 1000 train for Port Said, arriving at that Station at 1230. Went on board the H.Y.S. "Derflinger" (a captured German) at 1305. Went ashore during the afternoon, and had a good look around arriving back at 8 pm.
Entry.374: Laid in port all day. Had a swim. Left P.S. at 1700 and are now being escorted by two minelayers of the "P" class. I am not very sorry to see the last of Saeeda land. We have 1600 Gypos travelling aboard so we are looking forward to a lively time should anything .
Entry.375: At Sea. Escorts getting a rough passage. Gyppos very sea sick indeed. Feeling good and bright. At 10 am we had our gun practice, quite exciting, and the 1stshot gave the Gyppos a rude shock, causing them to squeal with fright. I hear we are going into Malta.
Entry.377: Still at sea, believe we will be at Mata tomorrow.
Entry.378: Arrived at Malta 12.45, and escort left us at outer harbour. Malta is indeed a fine place. On our left as we enter are the forts, and dwellings of the Garrisons. On our right are the Observatory and signal station. We anchored in the Harbor, close to the "Scourge","Breamer Castle", and "Ermine". There are two Japanese, 2 American, 2 Russian, 1 Italian, 3 French and 4 English destroyers, not to mention all kinds of mine sweeping craft.
Entry.379: Went ashore at 1100 and had a look around Valetta. Left Malta at 1700, and picked up old escort. Dropped a card to Elsie.
Entry.380:
Passed Messina at 0700 and through the Straits at 0830. The country seems to be pretty decent and the Coastline is very rugged.

The Italian coast is very pretty indeed. A railway line can be observed running paralell with the coast line. We continued to travel along the Coast of Italy, and had very pleasant "sing song" in evening. Went to Alarm Stations at 1700 and was told off to Company. Passed Mt Stromboli, an active volcano.
Entry.381: One of the chaps who came on board at Malta, died of dysentry. Weather very cloudy. Hugging the Italian coast. Passed a volcano at 1705. An uneventful day. Church parade at 1800.
Entry.382:
Met a chap in LancashireHussars who was born in Marrickville - rather a decent fellow. Dropped a card to Doug & Mum.

Passed the spot where the "Translyvania" was torpedoed. Expect to be in Marseilles at 1700. Tucker on board this old packet is very rank, Bread & Butter for Break, ditto for tea,Meat and Beans for lunch. Officers grub, 3 courses for Break,4 courses for lunch, 7 courses at Dinner - rather a bad principle for the canteen to adopt on transports. Arrived at Marseilles at 1915, and were tied up at 2000. The harbour is not so fine, but the buildings are magnificent and are down to sea shore. There is a finebig breakwater, with lighthouses at intervals, something similar to Colombo. The wharfage is laid out in quay style, and is thereforevery useful. There appears to be a very service.
Entry.383: Left the "Huntsgreen" at 1230 and entrained at 1800 for Le Harve . Beautiful country all along the Line. Travelled through some wonderful tunnels, one 4½ miles long. Will be travelling all night I believe. Met a chap from 1stA.L.H. on the Quay.
Entry.384: Travelling all night, arrived at Lyons at 0800. Some beautiful country thickly wooded and crossed a few magnificent Bridges, across the Seine. Weather very much like the last Spring. Quaint little villages, old fashioned farm waggons. Stayed at Lyons for breakfast.
Entry.385: Stayed at Vishny for 1 hour and had breakfast. This town is 5 kilos from Paris and by all appearances is some town. Travelled all last night. This is some train ride. Arrived at Nantes at 1000. Arrived at Rouen at 1800. Arrived at Le Harve at 2130 and proceeded to Rest Camp arriving at 2400. Had wet weather from Nantes to Le Harve. Only saw Rouen from train. Cathedral looks very fine. Met a bunch of Aust from Details.
Entry.386: Stayed at Rest Camp all day. Went to concert in Y.M. Had an argument with a Tommy. Weather wet. Saw a French wedding. Hear we are leaving for England tomorrow night. Big batch of Tommies left for Line.
Entry.387:
Left Rest Camp 1640, and embarked on the S.S. Londonderry, sailing at 2230. Rather rough sea. Slept under a tarpaulin with Smithy.

 T.U.V.
Entry.388: Arrived at Southampton at 0500 and disembarked at 7.30, proceeded to railway station and owing to some trouble arising over warrants was not allowed to proceed to London. Having got fixed up at the R.T's Office we had to wait until 17.30 for a train. Had dinner at a friend of Symthe's place and was quite a pleasure to get a square meal. Arrived at Waterloo 19.30 and reported to Horseferry Rd for instructions. Stayed at Y.M.C.A. for the night.
Entry.389: Received pass until tomorrow 1000, and proceeded to view the joint, went to Trafalgar Sqr, Buckingham Palace, The Coliseum in the evening, St James' Park, and St Pauls and the main scenes in the city. Visited Mrs Groom at Burdett Road, and Mr Trust. Weather fine.
Entry.390: Left London, at 1430 and arrived at Tidworth at 1810. Stayed night with the 13thA.L.H. and spent an enjoyable time. Weather wet.
Entry.391: Rained all day, arrived at Perham Downs at 1000. Put into hut with Smithy and Smythe, and wrote a few letters. Went to the Stadium in the evening, saw a good go in.
Entry.392: Smythe & Smithy went to hospital and I had a fair time, met Wally Crampton, had a little letter writing. Wet again today. Applied for leave.
Entry.393: Still at Perham Downs, heard nothing further about removal. Met Wally again and had a good talk. Met Yank Watson.
Entry.394: Went for long walk to Kimpton, with Smithy. Met old Yank Watson in a Diner, had a great timeafterwards. The boys are all well so I believe, big air raid on London, 20 machines, 157 casualties.
Entry.395: Went to Appleshaw in the evening. Had a very pleasant afternoon. Called at the Octagon Lodge.
Entry.396: Went to Luggershall and got my tunic. Paida visit to the Octagon Lodge and cancelled order. Smity came out of hospital.
Entry.397: Received orders to hold myself in readiness to depart for Lark Hill. Met Yank. Went to Luggershall & Tidworth during evening.
Entry.398:
Arrived at Lark Hill this afternoon from Perham Downs. Paid£1.0.0 Weather fine.

Met Snowy Lang, Coshim, Sutherland, Johnson, McDory, Ted Simpson and a few others. Having a rather mixed time. Went to Vauderville in the evening.
Entry.399: Had the following routine, which is fairly solid. 5.30 Reveille, drill till 7.0, Breakfast, Lecture from 8.30 to 11.00, Physics till 12.00, Gun drill 12.30Dinner, fall in 13.40, drill till 17.30. Had a trip to the cinema with Cash & Snowy.
Entry.400: Paid£1-0-0, bought some tobacco & necessarys. Weather still fine, put in application for leave (10 days). Gun drill and physics.
Entry.401: Gun drill & Physics during the morning; half holiday in afternoon. Completed my washing and sewing, wrote to Elsie & Doug.
Entry.402:
Gun Drill and ordinary routine.

Met some more of the boys and went to the Maple Leaf in the evening.
Entry.403: Same as yesterday, rained all day. Met Andrews, Pentreath.
Entry.404: Same as yesterday - rain continues. Bully, Cotter, all the boys arrived from Park House.
Entry.405: Same drill as yesterday - sports for today postponed owing to rain.
Entry.406: Lovely day today, rain cleared off - plenty of drill. Met PincherMartin and Watty Wade. Went to cinema with Andy.
Entry.407: Told off as Hut orderly and Mess ditto. Work - plenty of it. Weather fine. Had a letter from Les Fuller. Went to Y.M.C.A.
Entry.408: Expect to have new drafty arrive tonight. Am awaiting leave to be granted.
Entry.409: Leave granted, will go on Tuesday next. Went to Amesbury with Snowy & Billy. Weather fine.
Entry.410: Still on Mess Orderly job & going on leave tomorrow.
Entry.411: Left Camp 11.15 arrived London 15.10. Went to Hoferry Rd and drew money, purchsed watch, and met Wally.
Entry.412: Strolled round until 14.30 when Wally met a friend. Weather fine. Wrote to Douglas B.F., and went to Bank for Smithy, loaned£1-0-0 to Walter. Went to Hendon in the evening and had a good look around.
Entry.413: Called on Mrs Brown and got photo. She looks well. Went out with Walter and his friend to Hyde Park. Called at Commonwealth Bank and fixed up a cable. Weather fine. Wrote Mother and Smithy.
Entry.414: Met Wally and went to London Zoo. Had a good look around. Went to Home at Webley . Met some of the boys. Journeyed to Putney in evening.
Entry.415: Went to Kew Gardens, and Wembley. Had a good look around. Had to walk two & half miles to come home.
Entry.416: Spent day ay Wembley and had a very successful day. All family are very nice indeed. Will have to do something desperate.
Entry.417: Rained all day, spent evening with Olive.
Entry.418: Rained all day, spent evening with Olive.
Entry.419: Had a fine day, plenty of rain but spent lunch hour with O.J. Went to "Romance" in evening.
Entry.420: Had a lovely day, rained like - spent afternoon with D.J. at Smile. Met O. in evening and came home per 7.25 from G.C.R, journeyed to the Union Jack Hotel, and slept the sleep of the unjust - none at all.
Entry.421:
Left the Grafton at 
10 a.m.
 6 am, came back to Union Jack and left Waterloo Station on the 8.40 am choo choo for Salisbury. Arrived Amesbury 11.30, reached Larkhill 12 noon - on time.
Entry.422: Worked at Gun Drill etc - waht a strain. Felt like going A.W.L. for 10 more days.
Entry.423: Mess Orderly "no bon", too much work after such an easy time. Went to Palace in the evening.
Entry.424: Mess Orderly again to-day. No cop I suppose. O is down at Swansea, wish I was with her. Bully, Snowy Cotter, and Jones also Tom Downey left on draft for France. I'm sorry I am not with them.
Entry.425: Guard to-day, thank goodness no more M.O., for awhile. Weather wet, no bon. Wrote O. received some letters from home, very good noos.
Entry.426: Made a Limber Gunner this afternoon - does not seem too bad so far. Rained like hell all day.
Entry.427: Pay day, no felouse, discovered I was£2-0-0 overdrawn. Told off for Draft.
Entry.428: Taken off draft - marleesh, disappointed as I thought I had a chance of seeing Bully. Rained all day.
Entry.429: Rained like H. all day. Received letters from E., O, D.W., Mother and M. - all had good news.Andrews went A.W.L. to ?
Entry.430: Weather wet - still Limber Gunner and painter. Smithy got news of his leave.
Entry.431: Cricket party returned from London. Rained all day.
Entry.432: Smithy torments me all day about going to London on Thursday - B.B. Letters from O. & Mrs Tregoring.
Entry.433: Johnson went on leave today. Painting as usual.
Entry.434: Smithy went on leave at 12 o'clock. Olive leaves today for Home. Poor Kiddie I bet she does not like the idea of returning.
Entry.435: Smithy to call on Mrs Jones with my clothes. I hope she will "not-be" inconvenienced to any great extent. Weather wet.
Entry.436: Slow day, nothing new. Posted my watch and a letter to Bert.
Entry.437: Reinforcements arrived in Battery today. Still a L.G. Had a letter from Smithy. Brown left on Leave.
Entry.438: Reviewed by Duke of Connaught at Rolleston. Brilliant success.
Entry.439: Smithy arrived back from Leave, at 11 p.m. Had letters from Home.
Entry.440: Paid to-day. Draft being picked today, will know tomorrow. Post Registered packet to O.
Entry.441: Weather rotten, rainy and cold. Drill as usual.
Entry.442: Martin arrived from Sthampton after P.T. course.
Entry.443: Received a letter from Eve, and acknowlged same.
Entry.444: Went to Amesbury for Andy and had a long walk to Lake. Rained like blue blazes; Andy warned for draft.
Entry.445: Had a good walk with Andy again. Birthday, received a ring from Olive, as a present. Warned for draft.
Entry.446: Had a long letter from Eve, asking whether 'twould be possible fo me to meet her at the Salisbury Station.
Entry.447: Arrived Salisbury station at 1220, no Eve, returned to Camp, and met her on the road to Dorrington with Smithy. Arranged for her accomodation at the local village. Weather rainy.
Entry.448: Said goodbye to Eve, and she left per 1225 from Amesbury. Weather fine. Wrote Mother, Roy, O., & Mr Harvey.
Entry.450: Andy left on draft. Saw him at Amesbury Station.
Entry.451:
Sep
Received letter from Mrs Adam, Elsie very ill. Cabled for further information.
Entry.452: Smithy transferred to Sig. School. I am feeling fairly blue over the action. Collected Andy's cash at F.P.O. .
Entry.453: George & Will warned off for draft. George went to Trew, but had to stop on way owing to puncture. Air raid over London. No letters to date from Clements.
Entry.454: Sent Cables to Andrew Woolwich, and also one to Adam, Sandringham. Posted Andy's bag, and wired acknowledgment of receipt of cash to Andy's uncle.
Entry.455: Received a letter from "Stevo", Mrs Adam and Mum, also one from Les Fuller, (at Park House).
Entry.456: Received a letter and an Autograph Album from O.J., very nice indeed. Air raid over London.
Entry.457: Air raid over London. Russia in the Soup.
Entry.458:
Russia's position lost (Riga). Australians to return to the line.
Lent Smithy 10/-
Entry.459: George Driver, Will B. left for France, Painting all discs for horses.
Entry.460: Jones, Smith, and several others left for draft. Purchasedwarmer from Pat Henry.
Entry.461: Still painting. Run up by Adjutant but came off best. Met Fell, Aikins, Lowth, Strachan, Schultz. McDonald, and Hall, also Steinthal. Lent the latter 10/-.
Entry.462: Wrote long letters to all friends inc Bunty. Big Draft warned. Finished painting. Disappointed at Les's non arrival.
Entry.463: Les came down tonight great rejoicing, and we spent a convivial evening.
Entry.464: Wrote long letters to 12 people. Turner & crew warned for draft: returned to Limber Gunner work. Applied for 48 hours leave.
Entry.465: Went out with Les, and received letter from "Bully". Weather wet and miserable. Cutten to London as escorting N.C.O. Lent "Critt"£1.
Entry.466: "Cutt" returned, - sober in the early hours of the morning. Spent a quiet day writing letters.
Entry.467: Clocks put back 1 hour this morning makes a great difference in the time for bed. Went to pictures with E.J.F. "Noisy" & Cutt. "Salvoed" after the show. Raining like blazes.
Entry.468: Received Cablegram. E.A. Well again. Happy, received E.H. photo, also receipt from Mrs Woodcock and Sister Cummings.
Entry.469: Lent E.P.£1.2.6. Up for sleeping in. Got off, after a struggle. Got knocked back for 2 days leave - thanks to McMillan. Eric squared off. Wired O.J. Snowy Lang came back.
Entry.470: Wired E.C., and received letters from Mother & G.M. Spent a very busy day, stripping an Hydraulic Buffer.
Entry.471: Met young Purcell and E.J.F. Snowy Lang only got 6 days pay. Went to Palace with Les & Purcell.
Entry.472: Had photo taken in Amesbury, also by Frid & "Rosie". Had a visit to Amesbury with Frid, Snow, & Les. Weather fine. Wrote Mother & E.A. Still on Lim Gun. Had a letter from Bill Brown.
Entry.473: Very quiet day. Sayers for Drafy, also Ted Simpson. Went to palace good show.
Entry.474: Draft left. Met young Sid Jarman. Went to see Les Fuller.
Entry.475: Went to Cinema with Geddes. Draft warned off today, includes Piesse, Mac, & Samson. Had a long pow wow per letter with Els.
Entry.476: Went to L. Hill Cinema with Critt. Tyler went on leave, big party, letter from Andy. Air raid on London.
Entry.477: Moonlight raid on London fairly big damage done. Letter from O.J. full account of raid. Played cards & met Les. Rowdy transferred to No 2 Battery.
Entry.478: Met E.J.F., went to Concert in Y.M. applied for transfer to Sigs. Raid on London.
Entry.479: Raid on London. Went to Dorrington with Jim Fiddes met Les, and the remainder of the boys. Weather beautiful. Believe transfer coming through. Madden married to-day.
Entry.480: Paraded to Rowe, O.C. Sig School and was accepted, may go across tomorrow.
Entry.481: Transferred to Signal School, and placed with Hill in D. Sub. Went to pictures with Eric, Mac & Fiddes.
Entry.482: Said goodbye to Mac & Eric, went to show with Les and Snowy Lang.
Entry.483: Draft left for France, missed seeing them go, went to Pictures with Jim.
Entry.484: Went to palace with Les. Had a quietday.
Entry.485: Nothing doing, very quiet, raining hard.
Entry.486: Spent a very quiet day and evening.
Entry.487: Air raid on London, very quiet in camp, raining hard.
Entry.488: Very tidy weather, cold as can be. Received a pair of gloves from Eva.
Entry.489: Cold and clear, very quiet, nothing doing.
Entry.491: Despatched parcel to London. Received letterfrom Mrs Treg. Draft left. Despatched wire for Bloom.
Entry.492: Went to Amesbury with Jim. Met Les Edmondson.
Entry.493:
Marched to Heytesbury, via 
Heytesbury
 Shrewton, Chittern and formed new Camp.
Entry.494: Worked in Canteen with Murray, and Robbie. Smith still on leave.
Entry.495: Worked at Canteen as usual good job. Boys marched in at 5 p.m. Rained all day.
Entry.496: Large sick parade today. Weather fine & clear.
Entry.497: Went for stroll with Dick Pennell to Codford. Kits on their way.
Entry.498: Went to Warminster with Jim Fiddes, came home late and had a very enjoyable time. Warminster crowded with troops and impossible to get a "tuck in" owing rush.
Entry.499: Spent a very quiet Sunday, went down to Canteen with James, and to Church in the evening at Heytesbury.
Entry.500: Spent a busy day at N.A, buzzer and Lectures. Posted a few letters home, to Mother & E.A.
Entry.501: Applied for 4 days leave. Wrote O.J., Mrs Tregoring and one or two others.
Entry.502: Application turned down. Weather wet and wintry, very nicely sheltered in new "possie".
Entry.503: "Dickie" Rowe left for Shrewbyness , and I met Charlie Fry, from Moascar. Well wet weather tomorrow.
Entry.504: Quiet day, nothing very much to do. Working on O.P.
Entry.505: Working on O.P. with Tom Dempsey, Hills & Dunnage. Went to see old Jim.
Entry.506: Application for Leave, - granted. Weather wet, on O.P. today. Wrote Elsie. Went out with Jim.
Entry.507: Received letter from Les telling of Bully's being wounded. Also heard Cashin lost his leg and that Cotter's Mother had died.
Entry.508: O.P. to-day. Robbie with scabies, and Gillam. Air raid over London.
Entry.509: Air raid over London. Had a letter from the boys. Bill Brom & Driver both wounded.
Entry.510: Bill up in London, also Geo Driver. Had a hearty invitation from Mrs Tregoring.
Entry.511: Going on leave tomorrow, weather wet; received a letter from O.J., also some from Aust.
Entry.512: Left Codford, 10.15 - arrived Paddington 3 p.m. Went out on 4.15 to Wembley. Arrived Grafton 11.30, stayed night.
Entry.513: Went into see Bill Brown, spent a pleasant morning, went to "Cash on Delivery" with Dolly & Olive, and to a musical evening with Olive.
Entry.514: Stayed at Miss Dunt's and had a jolly time with Olive.
Entry.515: Went out with O. to Epsom but missed seeing George. Left Paddington at 12 midnight.
Entry.516: Arrived Swindon 4 a.m. left at 5.45. Arrived Heytesbury at 7.45 and reported in Camp on time.
Entry.517: Olive's Birthday, I hope she will get my letter. Weather fine and clear. Promoted to 5th Class.
Entry.518: Received letter from O. and M.W. Weather wet. Posted band to O., also papers to Bully and Brom.
Entry.519: Very quiet day. Had a letter from Les Fuller.
Entry.520: Had a quiet day. Hear that a draft has been warned. Went and volunteered to get on the draft.
Entry.521: Warned off for draft today, feel as happy as a Lark. Smithy on draft too. Wrote O., E., Mother, Len, Les and pals.
Entry.522: Received a letter from E. Mother and M.W. Trill happy.
Entry.523: Due to leave tomorrow. Getting rushed through gas and Q.M. Wrote Roy.
Entry.524: Had a quiet day. Robbie & North on draft left today. Rumoured we are not to leave until Friday.
Entry.525: Draft did not go to-day. Wrote O. & posted per Express Letters.
Entry.526: Had a letter from O. per E.L. Post very cheery. Received letters from L.O.S., Dot Watson and George Langdale. Smithy isolated for measles. He also told me that he had been married. Warned to leave in the morning.
Entry.527:
Said Au Revoir to the boys, and left Heytesbury at 11. Left Codford 1.30 and went to Sthampton, arriving there at 5.0 Left Sthampton on board S.S. "Archangel" at 10.30, arrived Le Harve and 3.30 a.m.

Spent a quiet night with Smithy and Pennell in an allyway on board.
Entry.528: Disembarked at Harve and landed at Rest Camp at noon after a fairly long walk. Murray still singing. My Bebe Rose, favorite. Had a feed of Sandwiches at the request of an officer.
Entry.529: Paraded at 8 a.m. and went through gas drill, lecture and gas. Arrived at Camp at 1600. Went to pictures with Smithy. Dick went to Strathen Hall with Ted Young.
Entry.530: Paraded to route march about 8 miles. Had a good bath in afternoon. Went to Stephny Hall with Smith, Dick, and Dickson. Nice evening altho' not very quiet. Have not had a shave for some time. Warned for Draft to the line.
Entry.531: Route march to MonteVillers . Met E.J.F. and had a good time, went to pictures.
Entry.532: Left Base for line. Arrived at Harve Station, 12.30 p.m. Left 5 p.m.Had a fairly comfortable passage in company with Ack, Dick & Dickie. Reached Hazebrouck at 1 a.m. Raining like blazes.
Entry.533: Passed St Paul at 1.30 a.m., passed Lilliers 10a.m. arrived Caestre at 5 p.m. Marched to Rest Camp. Visited a Café and an Estaminet in local village with Ack, Dick & Dickson. Hear guns booming all night. Raid by Taube at night. Expect to leave tomorrow. Showery weather.
Entry.534: Spent day in Rest Camp. Very windy all day also very cold. Expect to leave tomorrow. Hope we do. Fine all day, very cool wind.
Entry.535: Left Rest Camp 10 am, arrived Baillieu at midday. Left Bailleuand arrived at D.A., at 3 pm. Left D.A., and arrived at 54th Battery at 4.30 p.m. Told off to Ack sub "F", and got to bed early. Wrote to O., and Bully Clement. Pretty clean Waggon lines here. Fine all day.
Entry.536: Slept very badly last night, too cold. Spent the day in cleaning Specialists' gear, telescopes etc. Battery seems to be in a very good possie, some 2 miles away from here. Went for a walk with Dick and Dickson to neighboring village. Wrote 9 letters to friends. Heavy bombardment all day. Fine all day.
Entry.537: Spent morning cleaning bikes, and during afternoon I cleaned harness. Very heavy firing towards Ypres, and on our own front. Ack went up to the Battery this morning, wish I was with him. Weather showery. Dick Pennell suffering from Lumbago.
Entry.538: On specialist's spare gear all the morning with Palmer and another. Two men sent to Bty as relief for two other chaps. Battery copped some heavy shelling. Captive Sausage broke away from moorings, Antis put in good work, but "she" drifted in high wind out of range. A backsesh for Fritz. Spent the afternoon in Stables. Dick Pennell laid up with Lumbago - pretty badly. Have not received any letters yet. Weather Fine. Heavy shelling last night towards Ypres.
Entry.539: Dick still cronk. Heavy firing all day, very nice weather. Spent day on cleaning Specialists gear and bicycles. Have not heard from Smithy yet. Chipped about shaving by Lt Sheedy. Wrote E, A, today.
Entry.540: Very quiet today on this front. Still working on Specialist's gear. Weather wet and misty. Dick Pennell still "cronk". No mail so far. Operations at Cambrai ceased pro tem. Posted a letter to Mother. Mail from Australia arrived.
Entry.542: Nothing yet regarding transfer to Bty. Dick Pennell evacuated to hospital with Neurastina , he looked pretty cronk. Weather wet, and roads muddy, still on Specialist's gear. Repaired three bikes; and painted one. Feeling pretty good up to the present. Have not received any letters yet from across the way. Infantry jumped the "bags" and captured 100 Fritz's. Big stunt coming off shortly at the Guns. Some talk of a Signalling School opening shortly.
Entry.543: Snowed last night very cool today. Very heavy firing at Bty. Paddy & another chap had a fight over the location of a spud stack. Had an issue of rum, very good. Spent the day on mending bicycles and making a bunk. Snowed during the afternoon.
Entry.544: No alteration in daily routine. Snow during morning. Fritz paid a visit to our lines and brought down no few leaves - at 1 am. Weather cold. No mail yet from Berky. Played Crib all night.
Entry.545: Spent day amongst the horses. Had a nice ride in the morning. Fritz came across last night on separate visits twoof our guns knocked out. Team went up tonight to bring same down. Not inspected yet. Played crib at night.
Entry.546: Fritz over in his Gotha this morning, plenty of anti-aircraft work. Weather very frosty and on the ground everywhere. Worked on Waggon Lines all day. Taubes bombed camp and surroundings at 8 pm, 11 pm and three times during night. No casualties so far.
Entry.547: Rain, short of potatoes so raided a hutabout 4 kilos away. Fritz brought down Ypres about 7.30 p.m. Fritz bombed hereabouts without much effect. Weather frosty and very cold. Feet suffering some .
Entry.548: Received a letter and 8 others via Mr Broome, 3 from Toots, 2 from E.A., 2 from Mother , and 1 from Mrs Laddy. Weather freezing. Fritz over at day break. Washed all my clothes, and went for a bath, good news from Home.
Entry.549: Received letter from O.J., and a sketch from "Dok"". Rather good. Fritz put Shrapnel over the Camp, no casualties. Received a letter from Cousin Mary, also 2 photos. Weather wet. Received a good photo from O.J., also photo of myself on leave.
Entry.550: Received a number of old letters via Moascar. G.O.C. Genr. Basil inspected the Bty. The weather wet. Went along to see Sigs. at 15th Field Coy. Arrived back at the Camp.
Entry.551: Quite a series of sensations today. A Fritz had a go at one of our sausages and he was shot down. In the afternoon 5 Gothas came across when we were all in the waggon Park with the horses. He bombed us but without any results worth mentioning. Received a letter saying that Ron had been badly wounded and was in London his right leg and left arm also. Rotten luck for him, awfully blue over it.
Entry.552: Paid today, 40 Francs. Wrote Mother about Roy and received letters from Bill and O.J. Weather fine and clear. Orders for moving came today. Met 2 N.B.T. fellows today. Played cards tonight.
Entry.553: Lost 30 Francs. Went up the Bty this morning as horseholder. 5 Gothas raided here, 3 brought down by R.F.C. very smart work. Warned to be ready to go to guns tomorrow. Dick Pennel from hospital. Weather wet.
Entry.554: Arrived at Bty position at 8.10, arrived at G.O.S.pit and established communications by 10.30. At 9 p.m. gun coming in broke wires, had a very pleasant ? search. Received letters from "Steve", C, and Len Clement. Had a nice rum issue.
Entry.555: Had a fairly quiet day, registering and had aG.O.S. stunt. Fritz shelling fairly solidly. Weather wet, ground sloppy. Had a nice sing song in Evening. On duty till midnight. Received letter from O.J. Smithy did not come over today. Dick discussed the meritsof booze &best booze voted, rum, and a mixture of Champagne, Ginger ale, Ice & peaches.
Entry.556: On rising this morning I discovered that a 5.9 had lodged and burst 3 yds from dugout. Naturally the line had to be repaired. Went to trenches with Dick. Fritz did his usual morning and evening strafe. No damage up to the time of writing; Strengthened dugout.
Entry.557: Weather snowing, and fairly cold. Received a letter from Mary Croad, guess she is Eves Sister. Went to Bty for a walk. Shelled heavily at nightfall. Unearthed dead rats on roof of dugout. Had a very nice hot bath in a neighbouring dugout.
Entry.558: At time of writing I am just coming off watch. Fritz has been putting Gas across. Weather snowy, heavy fall. At present freezing. Dick & Bert to leave tomorrow. Letter from G.L. & O. No casualties so far.
Entry.559: Left "the possie" at 4.30 p.m., arrived at Lines 6 p.m. Weather Snowy, and intensely cold. Dick & Watson left in morning for Douliel .
Entry.560: Left Waggon Lines at 10.30, with Smithy & Cody. After a long walk arrived at new Lines near Daloulie . Feel fairly tired after long stretch.
Entry.561: Exercised horses, met Cock, Sayers, Bob from Waverley. The former in 11th Battn, the latter in the 53rd A.M.C. attach. Walked into Steenweck , long walk and arrived back safely. Weather freezing hard.
Entry.562: Revielle at 3.30 am, "pulled out" at 4 am. Passed through Doulelie , Hazebrouck and Staples , arriving Staples at 4 pm. Went for feed with G.B.W., Leon Verk & Ack, and struck a fine Eggs & Chips joint. Weather freezing all day. Very tired tonight. Billet fairly decent.
Entry.563: Had a fairly slippery road owing to heavy frost over same. Weather very cold. Halted at ---. Had very good billets. Slept with Smithy. Received three parcels, one packet and 7 letters. O.J., Mr Brown and one with Roy's time in from ? also 50 cigs from Eve. Letters from various letters.
Entry.564: Had a perfectly rotten day. Reveille at 4 am. Roads like glass with ice. Horses had a terrible time coming down everywhere. Had a nasty spill off horse, feet very bad owing to frostbite, very long march 50 kilo's, coldest day yet. Boys very unhappy. Rotten billets, arrived here 11.30 pm at our destination - Boulogne very tired and feel fagged.
Entry.565:
Had a fairly quiet day. Lost ten telephones and spent day looking for them. We are close to Lo. Haig's Hdqrs. Weather wet and miserable. 
Had
Poor prospects for tomorrow. Don't feel too bright. All village on rations, no eggs and chips or fish.
Entry.566: Xmas Day, no quite a happy day as one would have. Had the usual feed, boiled beef and potatoes - bacsheesh duff. Weather snowy. Snowstorm during the day. Roads like glass. Smithy went to Bolougne during afternoon.
Entry.567: As usual, snowed heavily during the night. Received a parcel from Miss Dunne, contents good, pastries & etc. Put on town Picquet, good job. Moved into new possie - good.
Entry.568: Weather good, spent a quiet day. Tommo went to Etaples. Went out pinching fowls, did not score. Had an arguement with old Frenchman and his missus. Boys all happy.
Entry.569: Went with Dick to Etaps & Paris Plage, the former a miserable hole, the latter a very nice spot. Rode in to Etapsin a lorry, came out in a Staff Car, Weather icy.
Entry.570: Weather - still snowing - very cold. Warned for guard this morning. Don't feel too well. Saw Keith Meillon at B.H.Q. .On guard tonight.
Entry.571:
Placed under open arrest for losing a watch. Weather fine but very cold.
Don't feel too happy. Smithy & Tommo at the dentist's. Payed 40 Frances. Plenty of drunks in Estaminet.
Entry.572: Tried by Spence, case dismissed, received apology from Cpl Bell. Weather very cold. Spent a quiet New Years Eve, in the Estaminet. Smithy & James, parayletic . Bought two fowls for tomorrows dinner.
Entry.573: Beautiful day. Had a very enjoyable dinner, consisting of Roast fowl, chipped Potatoes, Beans, Coffee & Ale. Smithy & James, parayletic during the morning & the latter during the afternoon. Plenty of drunks about the town, and Ack declares himself to be Scotch. Wrote letters in the Estaminet. Feel very happy in a sense, and made several new vows - as usual. Received cheerful lines from O.J.
Entry.574: Very quiet day. Played football during the morning. Snowed all day.
Entry.575:
Friday 1st
Usual daily routine, played Soccer in afternoon. Spent time in Estaminet. Heavy frost. Mac went to B to see his Sister.
Entry.576: Usual daily stint, unaltered. Played Rugby. Suffering from Toothache. Mac not home yet.
Entry.577: Suffered from Toothache all day. Rode 20 Kilos on glassy road to dentist, no result.
Entry.578: Rode to dentist and had tooth pulled by a very capable young gent. Received bevy of mail from Australia. Feel very happy as a result. Letters & photos via Mrs Brown.
Entry.579: Received letters from Aust via Olive, also two packets. Wrote answers to all my mail. Weather wet. Thompson went to Bolougne. Smith still chatting himself.
Entry.580: Very quiet day. Tommo & Smithy preparing for leave to Paris. Weather bad. Heavy blizzard left 10" of snow on the ground.
Entry.581: Heavy fall of snow. Weather very cold. Wrote to Roy. Nothing very much to do. Won at football versus 55th Btn. Tommo & Smithy left for Paris.
Entry.582: Weather wet & frosty. Tommo & Smithy leave commenced today. Dick Pennell on Cinema Staff. Battery winner today. Went for Dr at 9.30 pm.
Entry.583: Weather bleak but fine. Am going across to Bdge Hdqrs School perhaps. Still Bty runner,in Boulougne. Mac on stable picquet. Beat the A.S.C. 35-13.
Entry.584: Still B. Orderly, weather sloppy. Boys very happy. Beat 49th55-23. Good win, we are now premiers of our bunch.
